thread.title: ME Marine Warning and Forecast

author: Accuweather
title: ME Marine Warning and Forecast
text:
ME Marine Warnings and Forecast for Friday, March 22, 2024
GALE WARNING
URGENT - MARINE WEATHER MESSAGE
National Weather Service Gray ME
314 AM EDT Fri Mar 22 2024
...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON...
...GALE WARNING IS CANCELLED...
* WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 kt and seas 4 to 7 ft.
* WHERE...Penobscot Bay, Coastal Waters from Port Clyde, ME to
Cape Elizabeth, ME out 25 NM and Coastal Waters from Cape
Elizabeth, ME to Merrimack River, MA out 25 NM.
* WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT this afternoon.
* IMPACTS...Conditions will be hazardous to small craft.
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should avoid navigating in hazardous conditions.
...GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING...
* WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 30 kt with gusts up to 35 kt and
seas 6 to 9 ft.
* WHERE...Coastal Waters from Stonington, ME to Port Clyde, ME
out 25 NM.
* WHEN...Until 11 AM EDT this morning.
* IMPACTS...Strong winds will cause hazardous seas which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.
...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IS CANCELLED...
